required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Collection of Gingival Crevicular Fluid From Periodontitis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Collection of Gingival Crevicular Fluid From Periodontitis Patients

brief_summary.textblock: To collect GCF (gingival crevicular fluid) samples from diseased patients suffering only from gingivitis and/or periodontitis.

primary_outcome.description: One of 10 inflammation biomarkers found in gingival crevicular fluid (GCF) that are associated with inflammation that could lead to gingivitis. The number is a quantitative, normalized ion count from a mass spectral instrument. The lower the number the less inflammation may be present. Data is after 6 weeks use of the study treatment.

The number is a quantitative, normalized ion count from a mass spectral instrument. The lower the number the less inflammation may be present. Data is after 6 weeks use of the study treatment.

The number is a quantitative, normalized ion count from a mass spectral instrument. The lower the number the less inflammation may be present.Data is after 6 weeks use of the study treatment.

arm_group.description: Fluoride toothpaste (Colgate Great Regular Flavor) is the control for this study. All study toothpastes contain fluoride. The study is evaluating the additional ingredients in the other toothpastes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be aged 18 to 65 years inclusive
- Have a minimum of 20 natural uncrowned teeth (excluding 3rd molars) present
- Give written informed consent
- Be in good general health
- No known history of allergy to personal care/consumer products or their
- ingredients, relevant to any ingredients in the test products as determined by the
- dental/medical professional monitoring the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical condition which requires pre-medication prior to dental visits/procedures
- Advanced periodontal disease
- 5 or more decayed, untreated dental sites
- Diseases of the soft or hard oral tissues
- Orthodontic appliances
- Abnormal salivary function
- Use of prescription drugs.
- Use of antibiotics one (1) month prior to or during this study
- Use of any over the counter medications other than analgesics
- Erratic use of vitamin supplements
- Pregnant or breastfeeding.
- Participation in another clinical study in the month preceding this study
- Allergic to common dentifrice ingredients
- Immune compromised individuals (HIV, AIDS, immuno suppressive drug therapy)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: subjects were recruited by the PI at the clinical site
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects were screened to meet medical and oral health criteria and then began a 1 week washout period with fluoride toothpaste.

group.title: A - Control Comparator
group.description: Participants brushed their teeth with the fluoride only control toothpaste two times a day for six weeks.

group.title: B - Active Comparator
group.description: Participants rinsed their teeth with the Active Comparator toothpaste (fluoride/triclosan/copolymer) two times a day for six weeks.

group.title: A - Control Comparator
group.description: Participants brushed their teeth with the fluoride only control toothpaste two times a day for six weeks.

group.description: Participants rinsed their teeth with the Active Comparator toothpaste (fluoride/triclosan/copolymer) two times a day for six weeks.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

reported_events.time_frame: 7 weeks (1 week washout period + 6 week study treatment period)

group.title: A - Control Comparator
group.description: Participants brushed their teeth with the fluoride only control toothpaste two times a day for six weeks.

group.title: B - Active Comparator
group.description: Participants rinsed their teeth with the Active Comparator toothpaste (fluoride/triclosan/copolymer) two times a day for six weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
